title: Generate and install a 64×64 PNG favicon derived from the LookyLoo logo

requirements.text: Add the already-generated 64×64 PNG favicon asset (favicon-64.png) to the frontend static assets and ensure it is served by the app at a stable URL.

quotes: take the existing LookyLoo-logo.png thats on the Header and create your own favicon to put in the browser tab.

acceptanceCriteria: The repository contains the file favicon-64.png under frontend/public (preferred: frontend/public/assets/generated/favicon-64.png).
When the app is running, requesting the favicon URL returns a 200 and the content-type is image/png.

requirements.text: Update the HTML entry point (frontend/index.html) to reference the generated 64×64 PNG favicon instead of /favicon.ico.

quotes: create your own favicon to put in the browser tab.

acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html includes a <link rel="icon"> tag pointing to the PNG favicon URL (e.g., /assets/generated/favicon-64.png) and uses type="image/png".
The previous /favicon.ico reference is removed or superseded such that modern browsers display the PNG favicon in the tab.

requirements.text: Verify favicon rendering in both local dev and production build outputs so the browser tab shows the LookyLoo-derived favicon without relying on a .ico upload.

quotes: your shit is broken... do this instead.

acceptanceCriteria: In local dev (vite) the browser tab displays the generated favicon.
After building and serving the production assets, the browser tab displays the generated favicon.

constraints: Do not depend on uploading favicon.ico; use only the generated PNG favicon.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutablePaths.
Keep the backend unchanged (no canister changes needed for favicon).
nonGoals: Changing the existing header logo or other branding assets beyond favicon wiring.
